thread.title: Breeders’ Cup contender Talco dies during surgery
thread.title_full: Breeders’ Cup contender Talco dies during surgery

author: wtopstaff
title: Breeders’ Cup contender Talco dies during surgery
text:
Home » News » Sports » Breeders' Cup contender Talco… Breeders’ Cup contender Talco dies during surgery By The Associated Press October 10, 2015 6:04 pm 
ARCADIA, Calif. (AP) — Talco, who had earned a berth in this month’s Breeders’ Cup Mile at Keeneland, has died. 
Trainer John Sadler said Saturday the 4-year-old died while undergoing arthroscopic surgery a few days ago. 
Talco got into the Breeders’ Cup by winning the Grade 1 Shoemaker Mile on June 13. Talco had five wins in 17 career starts and earnings of $543,123 for owner Hronis Racing. 
He finished fourth in his last race, the City of Hope Mile on Sept. 27 at Santa Anita. Topics:
